title: Sentinel-2 MSI: MultiSpectral Instrument, Level-1C
description:
See also collection COPERNICUS/S2_HARMONIZED that shifts data with
PROCESSING_BASELINE '04.00' or above (after 2022-01-25) to be in the same range
as in older scenes.

Sentinel-2 is a wide-swath, high-resolution, multi-spectral
imaging mission supporting Copernicus Land Monitoring studies,
including the monitoring of vegetation, soil and water cover,
as well as observation of inland waterways and coastal areas.

The Sentinel-2 data contain 13 UINT16 spectral bands representing
TOA reflectance scaled by 10000. See the [Sentinel-2 User Handbook](https://sentinel.esa.int/documents/247904/685211/Sentinel-2_User_Handbook)
for details. In addition, three QA bands are present where one
(QA60) is a bitmask band with cloud mask information. For more
details, [see the full explanation of how cloud masks are computed.](https://sentinel.esa.int/web/sentinel/technical-guides/sentinel-2-msi/level-1c/cloud-masks)

Each Sentinel-2 product (zip archive) may contain multiple
granules. Each granule becomes a separate Earth Engine asset.
EE asset ids for Sentinel-2 assets have the following format:
COPERNICUS/S2/20151128T002653_20151128T102149_T56MNN. Here the
first numeric part represents the sensing date and time, the
second numeric part represents the product generation date and
time, and the final 6-character string is a unique granule identifier
indicating its UTM grid reference (see [MGRS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_Grid_Reference_System)).

The Level-2 data produced by ESA can be found in the collection
[COPERNICUS/S2_SR](COPERNICUS_S2_SR).

Clouds can be mostly removed by using
[COPERNICUS/S2_CLOUD_PROBABILITY](COPERNICUS_S2_CLOUD_PROBABILITY).
See
[this tutorial](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/tutorials/community/sentinel-2-s2cloudless)
explaining how to apply the cloud mask.

For more details on Sentinel-2 radiometric resolution, [see this page](https://sentinel.esa.int/web/sentinel/user-guides/sentinel-2-msi/resolutions/radiometric).

links.title: Run the example for COPERNICUS/S2 in the Earth Engine Code Editor

gee:schema.description: Granule-specific cloudy pixel percentage taken from the original metadata
gee:schema.name: CLOUDY_PIXEL_PERCENTAGE

gee:schema.description:
Cloudy pixel percentage for the whole archive that
contains this granule. Taken from the original metadata
gee:schema.name: CLOUD_COVERAGE_ASSESSMENT

gee:schema.description: Unique identifier of the datastrip Product Data Item (PDI)
gee:schema.name: DATASTRIP_ID

gee:schema.description:
Uniquely identifies a given Datatake. The ID contains
the Sentinel-2 satellite, start date and time, absolute orbit
number, and processing baseline.
gee:schema.name: DATATAKE_IDENTIFIER

gee:schema.description: MSI operation mode
gee:schema.name: DATATAKE_TYPE

gee:schema.description: Percentage of degraded MSI and ancillary data
gee:schema.name: DEGRADED_MSI_DATA_PERCENTAGE

gee:schema.description:
Synthesis of the On-Line Quality Control (OLQC) checks
performed at granule (Product_Syntax) and datastrip (Product
Syntax and DS_Consistency) levels
gee:schema.name: FORMAT_CORRECTNESS

gee:schema.description: Synthesis of the OLQC checks performed at the datastrip level (Relative_Orbit_Number)
gee:schema.name: GENERAL_QUALITY

gee:schema.description: Product generation time
gee:schema.name: GENERATION_TIME

gee:schema.description: Synthesis of the OLQC checks performed at the datastrip level (Attitude_Quality_Indicator)
gee:schema.name: GEOMETRIC_QUALITY

gee:schema.description: Unique identifier of the granule PDI (PDI_ID)
gee:schema.name: GRANULE_ID

gee:schema.description: US-Military Grid Reference System (MGRS) tile
gee:schema.name: MGRS_TILE

gee:schema.description:
Configuration baseline used at the time of the product
generation in terms of processor software version and major Ground
Image Processing Parameters (GIPP) version
gee:schema.name: PROCESSING_BASELINE

gee:schema.description: The full id of the original Sentinel-2 product
gee:schema.name: PRODUCT_ID

gee:schema.description: Based on the OLQC reports contained in the Datastrips/QI_DATA with RADIOMETRIC_QUALITY checklist name
gee:schema.name: RADIOMETRIC_QUALITY

gee:schema.description: Earth-Sun distance correction factor
gee:schema.name: REFLECTANCE_CONVERSION_CORRECTION

gee:schema.description: Imaging orbit direction
gee:schema.name: SENSING_ORBIT_DIRECTION

gee:schema.description: Imaging orbit number
gee:schema.name: SENSING_ORBIT_NUMBER

gee:schema.description:
Synthesis of the OLQC checks performed at granule
(Missing_Lines, Corrupted_ISP, and Sensing_Time) and datastrip
(Degraded_SAD and Datation_Model) levels
gee:schema.name: SENSOR_QUALITY
